New Records: Boston Celtics tied an NBA record with 29 three-pointers in a game.
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum hit a 3-pointer in the first seconds of the game.
Boston Celtics opened a 35-point lead against the New York Knicks.
Pre-Game Insights: The pregame ceremony included appearances by 96-year-old Bob Cousy, Cedric Maxwell, Paul Pierce, Kevin Garnett, and Ray Allen.
The Celtics wore special warm-up jackets trimmed in gold with 18 championship trophies embroidered on the sleeve.
A video was shown tracing the Celtics' title journey, including highlights of Havlicek and Russell winning titles in the 1950s and ‘60s.
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum expressed his emotions about the ring ceremony and the game, stating 'Let’s do it again.'
Coach Joe Mazzulla praised the team's mindset and response from the ring ceremony to the game.
Jaylen Brown reflected on the significance of their championship win and its place in Celtics history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics celebrated their 18th NBA title with a banner-raising and ring ceremony.
Owner Wyc Grousbeck handed out the oversized rings, with NBA Commissioner Adam Silver congratulating the players.
Coach Joe Mazzulla kissed the parquet floor before receiving his ring.
